definition: to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
surname Xiu
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
person pursuing religious practice (Buddhism)
the master leads you to the door, the rest is up to you/you can lead a horse to water but you can't make him drink
pinyin: shi1 fu5 ling3 jin4 men2 , xiu1 xing2 zai4 ge4 ren2
containing_words.word: 师父领进门，修行在个人

sentences.english: This is why a man of perfect practice can accomplish everything.
sentences.chinese: 这就是修行完备的人做任何事都能善尽其功的原因。

sentences.english: This is the straight mind, this is our practice in the dojo.
sentences.chinese: 这便是直心，这才是我们修行的道场。

sentences.english: "Come, let's enter inside", the yogi said to his disciple.
sentences.chinese: “来吧，我们一起进去”，修行者对他的弟子说。

sentences.english: Qi is the sword of man of practice.
sentences.chinese: 修行人的精气就是他的宝剑。

sentences.english: This practice has nothing to do with the nation or society you live in.
sentences.chinese: 修行者也完全没有要治国，甚至平天下的宏愿。

sentences.english: That morning, he woke up early and sat in meditation as usual.
sentences.chinese: 一大早起来，还是一样打坐，照常做修行的课程。

sentences.english: Any yogis who wishes to stay in this hermitage must accept and comply to the following terms.
sentences.chinese: 任何修行者想在本禅院修行都必须遵守以下条规。

sentences.english: Any yogis who wishes to stay in this hermitage must accept and comply to the following terms.
sentences.chinese: 任何修行者想在本禅院修行都必须遵守以下条规。

sentences.english: How is the Indian Yogi Surviving without food and water for 70 years?
sentences.chinese: 印度的瑜伽修行者如何能不吃不喝维持70年之久？

sentences.english: Landing must be pass the water, this is a good practice in flood life.
sentences.chinese: 登岸必须水中过，洪灾生活好修行。

sentences.english: In the lives which the religion leads, often cannot leave gymnosophists psychological activity.
sentences.chinese: 在宗教修行中，一般离不开修行者的心理活动。

sentences.english: In the lives which the religion leads, often cannot leave gymnosophists psychological activity.
sentences.chinese: 在宗教修行中，一般离不开修行者的心理活动。

sentences.english: The art for Qiu Qijing, has been a kind of cultivation, together with light and dust.
sentences.chinese: 艺术之于邱启敬，已经成为一种修行，和光同尘。

sentences.english: In this manner, Sangha can free their mind and concentrate on their practices to achieve the Holy Path.
sentences.chinese: 这样，僧人才能全心全力的专注在圣道的修行。

sentences.english: The profound and difficult concepts are actually the obstruct of practice.
sentences.chinese: 艰深而难懂的东西，反而是修行上的障碍。

sentences.english: The Veddahs have Animist and Buddhist practices.
sentences.chinese: 维达人信仰万物有灵论和修行佛教。

definition: to practice Daoism
(of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
to study/to practice
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
person pursuing religious practice (Buddhism)
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
ascetic practice
to become enlightened (Buddhism)
to reach illumination (Buddhism)
to enter the Way/to become a Daoist
to practice Zen (esp. meditation)
to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
Buddhism/Buddhist
to sit in meditation/to meditate
to cultivate the heart and nurture the character (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation
contemplation/meditation
